page.title: 06The Old Hull to Hornsea Line
page.content: We studied the old{railway}line, closed 20 years ago, between Ganstead and Swine. There are no traces of the track now, just black cinders. We walked along the track to the old station. It was derelict. There were holes in the wooden floor and no glass in the windows. There were the brick remains of coal cellars and we found a rusty nut and bolt. Along the track we saw dandelion, clover and dog roses growing. There were ants, butterflies, bees and some rabbit pellets lying near the side of the track. Opposite the station Mr & Mrs Southcoat live in Eastview Cottage. They have been married 59 years and they could remember when they used to catch the train to{Hornsea}to do their shopping.
